title: Finally, a streaming service made for nerds like me
content:
Macworld

Tired of endless cooking competitions and fake dating shows? MagellanTV is my answer. With no ads and no recurring fees, it’s the ultimate streaming service for documentaries and deep dives on topics like ancient civilizations, black holes, unsolved crimes, and space exploration.

MagellanTV offers lifetime access for $149.97 (regularly $999)—no subscription fees or irritating ads. The platform has over 3,000 documentaries and docuseries, from history and crime to science and culture. Some of my favorites include The Unsolved Killings of Jack the Ripper, Burnout: The Truth About Work, and John F. Kennedy: Making of a President.

When I’m unsure what to watch, I can turn on a documentary playlist and let it pick something new. Plus, the platform adds fresh content weekly.

MagellanTV also allows streaming on up to five devices so that I can share it with friends and family.

Get your lifetime subscription for $149.97 and ditch streaming service fees forever.
